name: Nishmat (The Jeanie Schottenstein Center)
description: The Jeanie Schottenstein Center for Advanced Torah Study for Women. A rigorous institution focused on advanced Jewish learning with text-based Torah study emphasizing serious scholarship. Offers multiple programs including Shana Ba'Aretz for post-high school, LIBA program, and the renowned Yoatzot Halacha fellowship. Known for integrating Torah study with Machshava (Jewish philosophy), Chasidut, and personal growth workshops.
address: The Alisa M. Flatow Building, Berel Locker 26A, Pat, Jerusalem, 9328249, Israel
applicationDeadline: Contact school for details - Rolling admissions

meals.notes: Full meal plan provided in dining facilities

shabbos.details: Students typically spend Shabbat with host families throughout Jerusalem. Occasional in-seminary Shabbatons organized for community building.

distances.notes: Located in Pat neighborhood, south Jerusalem

shanaBet.details: Advanced learning programs available; Yoatzot Halacha 2-year fellowship for qualified students

opportunities: Homework help for elementary and high school students
Food distribution to approximately 30 needy families every Friday
Working with elderly and disabled women and children

onSite: The Monique C. Katz Bet Midrash (study hall)

transportation.notes: Well-connected to central Jerusalem and major areas

programs.name: Shana Ba'Aretz
programs.description: Post-high school year program with immersive Beit Midrash experience

programs.name: LIBA Program
programs.description: Post-high school spiritual and intellectual development

programs.name: Yoatzot Halacha
programs.description: Two-year advanced halacha fellowship - leading program for women's halachic studies
programs.target: Women with demonstrated Talmudic scholarship and leadership potential

programs.name: Israeli Midrasha
programs.description: Program for Israeli women post-military/national service

specialFeatures: Only institution offering Yoatzot Halacha certification
Personal guidance from Rabbanit Atara Eis and Rav Da'vid Sperling
academicApproach: Integration of Torah with spiritual expression

estimatedOrTypical: cost (estimated at $27,000 based on similar advanced seminaries)
